definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: At the end of this phrase, the music modulates from C to G.
sentences.chinese: 這個樂句結束時，音樂從C調轉爲G調。

sentences.english: Phrase in order to deal with more than "double sentence" there.
sentences.chinese: 樂句處理多以“句句雙”出現。

sentences.english: It also began Coover's now-trademark riffs on fairy tales and bedtime stories.
sentences.chinese: 它也開始對童話和睡前故事庫弗現在，商標樂句。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
Guan Hanqing (c. 1235-c. 1300), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
